results.title: An Oriental city: Canton China
results.creator_credit: Louis de Rochemont Associates, Louis De Rochemont and Victor Jurgens
results.brief_description: In ancient oriental cities where there is contact with other countries through trade, there is an incongruous mixture of modern ways with the old. Canton is an old city steeped in the traditions of many generations. Its location of the Si River makes it an important centre of commerce and industry.

results.title: An Ordinary woman
results.brief_description: Jackie is 38 years old. She lives with John and they have two small children. Once she wanted to be an opera singer. Once she had a boyfriend called Paul who married someone else. Once she travelled overseas. In the Sixties she was in love with Charlie. In the Seventies she sang in a band. In the Eighties she makes scones with the kids. In the process of (re) presenting an ordinary woman’s life this film explores questions of identity, representation and truth.

results.title: An Ordinary half hour in the extraordinary life of Robin Beckett
results.brief_description: Produced originally for inclusion in the Melbourne University Architectural Student’s Revue, this witty satire denounces the conformity of modern urban society through the character of Robin Beckett, who lives in a rubbish bin and falls in line with other members of his social group. Reviews incidents of a day in his life. No credits available.

results.title: An Opera prepares: 'Eugene Onegin'
results.creator_credit: Bosisto Productions, Brian Bosisto, Mario Andreacchio and Lesley Hammond
results.brief_description: A film made for use in secondary schools, to show the work and preparation that is involved in staging an opera performance, in this case, “Eugene Onegin”. Shows both the behind-the-scenes preparations and a dress rehearsal. Features the South Australia Opera Company and music by the ABC Symphony Orchestra. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: An Open space secondary school at work
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, John Morris and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: Shows how individual differences in students’ capacity to learn can in fact be used to benefit their intellectual growth. It gives an inside view of an Open Space School in operation, showing the advantages and day-to-day methods used in the Open Space School layout. Some of the problems which must be faced and solved by staff as well as students to promote an efficient and effective school are discussed.

results.title: An old box
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Paul Driessen
results.brief_description: An animated story of a beggar who repairs an old box, in order to set it up and ask for donations. As he stands in the street he gets cold, so he climbs into the box to keep warm. At once a spectacular star descends from the sky to the box and when it returns to the sky, it takes with it the ghost of the beggar. A film without words. (Awards: Chicago; San Franscisco; Melbourne; Dubuque: Los Angeles; Les Menuires.)

results.title: An Officer and a gentleman
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lorimar Film Entertainment, Martin Elfand and Taylor Hackford
results.brief_description: Taylor Hackford (Against all odds, Proof of life) directed “An Officer and a gentleman”, starring Richard Gere and Debra Winger. It is the story of Zack Mayo (Gere) a man of uncertain future who is in conflict with his identity. A life of familial instability has left Zack unwilling to engage emotionally with others, especially women. Zack determines that he favours a career as a navy pilot, largely to prove to his alcoholic father that he is a son worthy of respect and capable of achievement. His steely demeanour suits military life but is in part broken down by his romance with a local factory girl Paula Pokrifi (Winger). Life in the armed forces is depicted as brutal and inhumane as the recruits make their way through a gruelling 13-week course. Foley, (Louis Gossett, Jnr) the irascible Major in charge of the recruits, rides Mayo particularly hard as he recognises in him Officer material. Mayo is torn between his cold conduct that shelters him from feeling anything and his burgeoning love for Paula. “An Officer and a gentleman” won Oscars for Gosset (Best Supporting Actor) and Best Song for “Up where we belong”.

results.title: An Italian family: life on a farm
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description: This film presents geographic and cultural aspects of Italy with an account of one family living on a small farm, who, unlike many Italians seeking modernisation, avoid mechanisation in preference for a simple way of life. With collaboration by Edoardo Capolino.
